content: Manicouagan Reservoir (also Lake Maicouagan) is a lake in central Quebec, Canada, formed approximately 214 million years ago, by the impact of a meteorite 3 miles in diameter. It’s sometimes called the “eye of Quebec” because in its center is a lake island, an artificial island known as Rene-Levasseur Island, and including the Louis-Babel Ecological Reserve__no.0750, 2021.
